forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy fog. Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. Northeast wind around 5 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.shortForecast: Areas Of Fog then Partly Sunny
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 10am. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. North wind around 7 mph.

weather_report:
As the city begins to stir awake, the air carries a hint of chill, enveloped in the gentle embrace of patchy fog that clings to the lesser-known corners of Downtown San Francisco. The skies lean towards an awakening brightness, suggesting that the sun will soon pierce through the gray curtains of low-lying clouds, revealing the iconic skyline and the magnificent Golden Gate in all their glory. With a forecast high lingering around fifty-eight degrees, the day promises a gradual escalation from the coolness of the early hours to a more temperate feel by afternoon. 

In this subtle dance between fog and sun, the best attire would cater to the crispness of morning—perhaps a light sweater or jacket, perfect for the brisk breeze that weaves through the streets. As the fog lifts, consider a leisurely stroll down one of the lesser-trafficked avenues, or perhaps an afternoon spent in the cozy confines of a local café, letting the lingering coolness be a companion to a hot cup of coffee or tea. Whether one ventures out for a quiet walk or engages in a bit of people-watching from a sidewalk perch, the evolving landscape promises a day of quiet beauty, tinged with the mystique that only San Francisco can offer.
